Class HiddenBox

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Box
HiddenBox
public class HiddenBox extends Box
HiddenBoxes are a type of Box that should be used for detection, but are not to be used as CollisionBoxes (e.g. entity hitboxes in a game). An applicable usage is to use a HiddenBox as hit boxes for an attack, or to check if there is an Actor at a specific point before doing something. When visible, HiddenBoxes will be of color blue.
Version:
2024-03-08
Author:
Freeman Wang

  • Constructor Details

    • HiddenBox

      public HiddenBox(int width, int height)
      Creates a basic HiddenBox, which is basically a box. Should be used for temporary collision checking, so having it visible or invisible does not matter.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the HiddenBox.
      height - The height of the HiddenBox.

    • HiddenBox

      public HiddenBox(int width, int height, boolean visible, greenfoot.Actor owner)
      Creates a HiddenBox that is tied to an owner.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the HiddenBox.
      height - The height of the HiddenBox.
      visible - Whether the HiddenBox should be visible.
      owner - The Actor that the HiddenBox should follow.

    • HiddenBox

      public HiddenBox(int width, int height, boolean visible, greenfoot.Actor owner, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Creates a HiddenBox that is tied to an owner, but with an offset.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the HiddenBox.
      height - The height of the HiddenBox.
      visible - Whether the HiddenBox should be visible.
      owner - The Actor that the HiddenBox should follow.
      xOffset - The x offset in pixels, for the HiddenBox's following.
      yOffset - The y offset in pixels, for the HiddenBox's following.
